### Helmin J. Caba, Mayor

![Mayor Caba](https://cdnsm5-hosted.civiclive.com/UserFiles/Servers/Server_11204924/Image/Mayor/Mayor%20Caba/MayorCaba_BioPic.jpg "Mayor Caba")
Mayor Helmin J. Caba has lived in Perth Amboy since 1977, and considers it a blessing to have grown up in our historical City of Perth Amboy. He believes that his faith and family upbringing molded him into a stronger person physically and mentally. Mayor Caba and his wife Wendy are lifelong residents and homeowners. They are the proud parents of their son Adam and daughter Audrey.

Mayor Caba was born in La Vega Province of the Dominican Republic in 1973. After emigrating from the Dominican Republic, His parents, Jorge and Gladys Caba, instilled upon him the importance of hard work and the feeling that no matter how successful you are you have a responsibility to help others. His parents led by example in achieving the American dream they so solidly embraced. They became American citizens and worked multiple jobs to support their family.

Mayor Caba has deep, strong roots in Perth Amboy, and is a member of the Most Holy Name of Jesus Parish. Striving to empower those around him, Mayor Caba has a long history of community activism and volunteerism. He cares deeply about our future and is committed to work as hard as necessary to make our city a better place to live and work. As a community leader that has experience in different fields, he brings fresh vision and renewed energy to Perth Amboy government.

* Former City of Perth Amboy Councilman (2016-2020)
* PADO committeeman for Ward/District 1-1
* Former Union Member / American Federation of Teachers (AFT) member for the Perth Amboy School District
* Former Board member of the Perth Amboy Arts Council
* Former Board member of the Perth Amboy Municipal Alliance
* Former Board member of the Perth Amboy Catholic Schools Advisory Council
* Former board member of the Perth Amboy Historical Preservation Commission
* Former Member of The Citizens Campaign Organization
* Former President of the Latin-American Softball League for 10 years
* Member of the Most Holy Name of Jesus Parish in Perth Amboy, NJ

For a copy of Mayor Caba's bio,
click here

Office of the Mayor
-------------------

* [Office of the Mayor](https://www.perthamboynj.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=11205008&pageId=12069664#ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl28_divTabs_0)

[Office of the Mayor](https://www.perthamboynj.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=11205008&pageId=12069664#ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl28_divTabs_0)

The Office of the Mayor encompasses the Mayor's executive staff, including Chief of Staff of the Mayor's Office, Mayor's Aide, Executive Assistant, and  Communication staff. The office arranges special programs, annual initiatives, and public communications.
Mayor Helmin J. Caba serves as the chief executive and administrative officer of the city while overseeing all city departments, enforcing the charter and ordinances of the City and via departments recommends legislative actions and policies.

Request a Meeting

All meeting requests with the Mayor must be submitted in writing and via email to
[mayorsoffice@perthamboynj.org.](mailto:mayorsoffice@perthamboynj.org)
Office Hours are from 9:00 a.m.- 5:00 p.m.  However, an after-hours meeting may be accommodated.

Send an Invitation

All invitations requesting Mayor's attendance must be submitted in writing and via email to
[mayorsoffice@perthamboynj.org.](mailto:mayorsoffice@perthamboynj.org)

Request a Citation/Proclamation/Flag Raising

If you would like to request a citation or proclamation from the Mayor, please email your request to:
[mayorsoffice@perthamboynj.org.](mailto:mayorsoffice@perthamboynj.org)
Details on documentation needed for preparation will be provided after your inquiry is received.

### Historic City of Perth Amboy

Perth Amboy, an urban community with a rich cultural history and a more than 300 year old maritime and industrial legacy. The City comprises a land area of 4.55 square miles with a population of 50,814 according to the 2010 Census.

Call for Artists: Black History Month Exhibit

The Perth Amboy Gallery Center for the Arts is now accepting artist submissions for the upcoming Black History Month Exhibit. Artists working in all visual art disciplines are encouraged to apply.
**Application deadline: January 31.**
